description: Remember when everyone was driving full-sized cars like this 1970 Chevrolet Impala Custom? Life was good, big V8s were in fashion, effortless highway cruising was the norm, and luxury was standard. Journey back with us to those days of your childhood and enjoy the good life at a surprisingly affordable price.

OK, we know a Gobi Beige Impala isn't going to set the world alight with desire, but look carefully at this extremely well-presented Imp. When was the last time you saw one, let alone one this straight and clean with a substantial pile of money invested in a restoration? I mean, nobody restores these cars, right? Well, here's one of the nicest, with super straight bodywork, doors that open and close easily, and a no-frills look that's appealing in today's over-styled age. Gobi Beige is the car's original color and it looks totally appropriate on a luxury cruiser designed for more civilized society. There's no question about it, this is a big car, but it also looks muscular so it carries the size well, and the bodywork is so shockingly straight that you'll do a double take when you see your reflection in the quarter panels. Excellent chrome bumpers, a simple grille, and the Impala's traditional triple taillights give this car a familiar look that will bring back great memories. And we have to say the black vinyl top, which is also in fantastic shape, gives it a bit of an edge that's much appreciated.

The black interior is a combination of old and new components, and shows off a lifetime of easy living. Bench seats mean there's room for everyone inside, and the smattering of luxury equipment means that this is a fantastic road trip candidate for those long journeys. The upholstery is in excellent shape with only minor signs of age and activity, the carpets are a little faded but certainly not in need of replacement, and the door panels appear almost new with original arm rests still in place. A tilt steering column and a modern AM/FM/iPod stereo are welcome features for those long-distance drives. A few woodgrained details on the doors and steering wheel remind you that this is Chevy's top-of-the-line, and rear seat occupants are treated to spacious first-class accommodations. A giant trunk looks like it'll help you move your apartment and all that sheetmetal inside is covered in correct spatter paint and finished with a matching Rally wheel and a new redline radial.

Chevy's 350 cubic inch V8 is a great choice in the Impala, powerful and torquey, yet much easier on gas than a big block. The matching-numbers small block is nicely detailed with bright Chevy Orange paint and a correct air cleaner up top, and thanks to careful maintenance, it's a great runner. They didn't try to upgrade it with the usual parts, instead leaving it as the factory intended and once you experience it, you won't wonder why. It's so smooth you can barely feel it running and on the road the matching numbers Powerglide transmission shifts
title: 1970 Chevrolet Impala

description: Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1970 Cadillac De Ville Convertible. We scour the country for vintage cars and trucks and we rarely come across one like this! You must see and drive this rare De Ville!  HISTORY  In 1970 a facelift included a grille with 13 vertical blades set against a delicately cross-hatched rectangular opening. The bright metal headlamp surrounds were bordered with body color to give it a more refined look. Narrow vertical "vee" tail lights were seen again, but now had additional smaller V-shaped bottom lenses pointing downward below the bumper. Wheel discs and winged crest fender tip emblems were new. Exterior distinctions came from a DeVille script above the rear end of the belt molding and from the use of long rectangular back up light lenses set into the lower bumper as opposed to the smaller square lens used on the Calais. A new feature was a body color border around the edge of the vinyl top covering, when this option was ordered. 1970 was the last model year for pillared sedans until hardtops were permanently dropped in 1977. It was also the last year the DeVille ever offered the convertible body style. A total of 181,719 DeVilles were sold, accounting for 76% of all Cadillacs. Never again would Cadillac sales be dominated to such a degree by a single model. SOURCE: WIKIPEDIA  SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION  EXTERIOR   -White Vinyl Convertible top!  -Black paint with nice brightwork.  -Roadhandler 235/75R15 tires.  -Factory Cadillac wheels.   INTERIOR  -Factory interior.   -Uncut dash.  -Power options!  MECHANICAL  -472 V8.  -Automatic.   -Power top!  DISCLOSURE  -There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint. (See detailed pictures)  -Upholstery and vinyl top show sign of age. (See detailed pictures)    Own this vintage 1970 Cadillac De Ville at wholesale cost. The cost of parts and restoration of these vehicles are increasing daily. Buy one complete and ensure your investment for the future. Don't do the work yourself, get one finished for roughly half of the cost of building it yourself!   An excellent investment and something you can enjoy daily. Collectible vintage vehicles have historically appreciated at a rate greater than that stock market, gold and other arts and collectibles as documented by many articles and auction result tracking.     NEED MORE DETAILED INFORMATION? CALL US AND WE WILL HELP ANY WAY POSSIBLE!   1-877-422-2940  WORLDWIDE VINTAGE AUTOS [. C O M ]     FINANCING:  JJ BEST BANC. COLLECTOR CAR FINANCING  800-872-1965  Please mention you are working with Worldwide Vintage Autos in order to expedite the process.  DEPOSITS:  Deposits to hold vehicles is $500. Upon payment of the $500 deposit, the vehicle will be held for 7 days pending final payment. Deposits are non-refundable due to i). the vehicles are taken off the market and we turn down other buyers during the 7 day period and ii). there is significant re-marketing costs associated with relisting / remarketing our vehicle

description: GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1970 Ford Bronco for purchase. The classic Broncos are a timeless look and very popular go anywhere work horses on wheels. These very successful SUV’s were often used for every bit of life they had, making finding one with good bones hard to find. Yet the classic Broncos popularity has never gone away and remain highly sought after as nostalgic survivors and as awesome custom off-road warriors.

The Bronco offered here has a 302 v8 mated to a 3 speed manual transmission with the “3 on the tree” lay-out.  It runs and shifts smoothly as it should.  The exterior shows years of love and use that all add up to its current state of “patina.”  The truck remains fairly solid and has good bones, whether you choose to leave it as is and enjoy it or do some restoration, this is the perfect candidate either way.  The seats remain in great shape.  The truck retains its original AM radio and also has a working aftermarket Alpine CD player.

This Bronco was sold new at the Lexington Auto Sales Ford dealer in Massachusetts.  It comes with an original sales brochure, owner’s manual and original dealer jacket.  The Bronco has a removable hard top as seen in the photos; it’s a blast to drive with the top off.  Other options include beautiful hubcaps, new shocks all around, new voltage regulator, newer flame thrower coil, new washer fluid reservoir, original jack and tire iron mounted on the inner fender under the hood.  This truck has years of life and use left, it just needs a new owner.  Don’t miss your opportunity to own this collectable piece.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com
title: 1970 Ford Bronco

description: For sale in our Chicago showroom is a true survivor 1970 Chevrolet C-20 4x4 Pickup.  These old pickups are becoming increasingly scarce and very hard to find in their original state and this metallic maroon beauty still has under 37,000 actual miles from new.  As soon as you step inside and take a seat on the immaculate velour seat and close the heavy metal door you have a feeling of how well built these old Chevys were.  This truck is solid from top to bottom and you can feel how heavy and strong it is as soon as you start driving. The low first gear make this ideal for towing a boat or that vintage camper and is sure to get some looks on the open road. One turn of the key on the dash board and the original numbers-matching 307 Cubic Inch V8 fires up immediately and runs whisper quiet.  These trucks were meant for use and hauling and with a low first gear is ideal for towing and also will cruise along all day at highway speed.  The original bench seat has been replaced with a more modern GM seat with new upholstery and seat belts.  In addition the truck was painted a few years back but is high quality and looks fantastic.  The window rubber was recently replaced as well and a Lund sun visor was installed.  This truck originally came equipped with a wood truck bed that has now been replaced with pressure-treated wood.  From top to bottom this is a very well-built and clean truck that is very hard to find and adding that it still has under 37,000 original miles makes this a rare bow-tied workhorse indeed.  Located in our Chicago showroom, this solid 1970 Chevrolet C-20 4x4 can be seen including an HD video and pictures at www.gatewayclassiccars.com.  For additional information please call (708) 444-4488 or email chicago@gatewayclassiccars.com.

This 1970 Dodge Dart Swinger has been updated in a few ways; she has a 340cid 4bbl motor (originally a 318cid 2bbl) coupled to her 3-Speed Torqueflite automatic transmission. description: Here is a beautiful 1970 Oldsmobile Cutlass in great condition inside and out. The car features a strong 350ci Small Block (believed to be original) and really moves. These Olds Coupes have been steadily increasing in value and are at an all time high as far as demand goes so don't miss your chance to take home THE premier Cutlass to own...Bid Now!! The list of some of the equipment:        -Olds Small Block V8      -Edelbrock Carb and HiRise Intake Manifold      -Accell Performance Electronic Ignition      -TH400 Automatic Trans      -Power Brakes      -Power Steering      -Bucket Seats with Console      -Console Mounted Gagues      -Aftermarket Stereo     The exterior on the car is in great condition and is and is finished in Red with matching Rally wheels. The paint is a driver quality paint job and has been rubbed to a smooth as glass finish. The fenders are all arrow straight and all body lines are correct.  All of the spoilers and body kits are in good shape. The entire car is original steel and never had an rust or patch panels EVER. The red exterior beautifully compliments the white interior and white letter tires. All correct emblems are in place and in good shape.      The interior is in great shape all around. The original Vinyl  interior is clean and is in very good shape. The seats have no tares or ware spots. The dash has no cracks.  and carpet are very good condition and are like new. All gauges work correctly and are very clean and bright. The car has Cold A/C and an aftermarket CD Player. Custom Olds floor mats are at foot.    Mechanically, this Cutlass runs great. The 350ci runs very strong. It shifts through the gears very strong and smooth and puts all the power to the ground through brand new tires. Under the hood is detailed to show specifications using all correct paint and decals as well as correct chrome accessories. The motor is topped by Edelbrock performance intake and carb combo, with Edelbrock Aluminum valve covers. The ignition has been converted to Accell performance electronic ignition and high performance wires. Under the hood looks as good as this car runs and sounds.    All in all, this is one very clean and incredibly powerful Cutlass. This car was professionally maintained and was a labor of love for the previous owner. It will be just as comfortable on the street or in a private collection where it can be stared at for hours on end. Please email or call with any questions and we can help with shipping quotes and arrangements.  We also welcome International bidders. Any further questions please call Jon at 480-703-2337. description: Exceptionally well preserved, this 1970 Pontiac Le Mans is exactly the kind of classic for someone looking to reconnect with a past era.  Only restored and updated in the essential areas (like the professional repaint or hidden modern stereo,) this is an exceptional, affordable time machine.

Triple black is for muscle cars, but triple yellow is reserved for coupes like this that represent vintage grand touring in the '70s.  You might have not thought of a presentation like this before, but this Le Mans certainly proves its appeal. Pontiacs of this era have something special about them.  The GTOs that were based off this design are cars of legend today.  And while we cherished the Endura front end of those back in the day, the chrome of the Le Mans seems to make a bolder statement today.  It's like a shiny beak of a bird that's ready to take fight.  It matches nicely with the other bright elements like the form-fitting rear bumper, complete window trim, and the iconic Rally II wheels.  But the real desire on this car is inspired by its sunny shade of yellow.  Professionally repainted its factory-correct Sierra Yellow, it's a classic that just wants you to smile back at it.  Plus, the nicely coordinated vinyl roof gives this a premium touch that makes the Le Mans look like you rescued it from at 45-year slumber.

Open the door to see the pristine tan/beige/yellow vinyl interior that completes the interesting triple yellow package (i.e. the sunny colors of the exterior paint, vinyl roof, and interior.) You paid a little bit more for a Pontiac back in the day, and the premium difference can be felt the moment you sit down in the bucket seats.  Plus, the wood paneling on the center console and dash add to the first-class atmosphere.  This car feels highly original, and exceptionally well preserved in the interior, so we wouldn't be surprised if the low 51,755 miles on the odometer were actual.  The tan two-spoke steering wheel has the unmistakable soft center that GM enthusiasts will instantly remember the moment you take control.  You gaze over an amazing dash that has all the right factory pieces, such as the round gauges and heat/defrost controls with provisions for factory air conditioning.   But even with this exceptionally well-presented interior, there is room for a modern upgrade.  So while the AM radio looks great in its correct position, the real tunes come from a more modern AM/FM/CD unit in the glovebox.

When you lift the hood, you immediately recognize the blue block of the Pontiac 350 cubic-inch V8 radiating out of the engine bay.  You'll love lifting the hood at car shows and showing off the very correct presentation that even includes the right stickers on the air cleaner.  In fact, we wouldn't be surprised if this Pontiac still has its original powerplant.  There is a nice hint of rumble from the updated dual exhaust, but this Le Mans never betrays its comfortable cruiser heart.  The three-speed automatic transmission, power steering, and power brakes all make for a very pleasing anytime classic.

Complete with factory buildsheet and owner's manual, this is a true classic that is original where you want it, and has already had investments in all the right places.  So at this price, you know you need to be quick to take this beauty home.  Call today!!
title: 1970 Pontiac Le Mans

description: Check out this gorgeous, unmolested 1970 C10 Custom pickup. This truck looks great having been stored in a garage for most of its life. Coming from Oklahoma means it is rust free and it also happens to be accident free as well. This truck is a factory two-tone Medium Olive with a white cab over a green deluxe interior. It has factory air conditioning, factory power steering, and factory power brakes. The 350 V8 is strong running and sounds great through mellow dual exhaust. The 3-speed automatic is smooth shifting and all the gauges work!  The truck was repainted 24 years ago in 1991 and still looks great today. The interior is mint and the under body looks like new! The truck appears to be an original, honest truck and is largely untouched. This truck drives as well as any new truck and has the excellent ride this body style is famous for! Call today to schedule an appointment to check out this sweet truck.
title: 1970 Chevrolet C/K 10 Series

description: For sale is a 1970 Mercury Cougar Convertible located in our Indianapolis showroom. 1970 was the last year of the first generation Cougar body style which most believe to be the most desirable body style. Returning to a vertical grille theme, the 1970 Cougar resembled the 1967-68 models, however, the center grille divider was more pronounced that ultimately added over 2 inches to the Cougar's overall length. This 1970 Mercury Cougar Convertible is powered by its 302 CID V8 Engine and is backed by a 3-speed automatic transmission. The car received a custom two tone green and gold job using PPG paint back in 2012 and is sure to set you apart from the crowd. The white power convertible top nicely compliments the newer paint scheme and makes dropping the top down on nice days effortless. The interior is still sporting its original green vinyl interior and considering it is nearly 50 years old it still shows well. Options on this 1970 Mercury Cougar Convertible for sale include: Power Convertible Top, Power Steering, Seat Belts, Vinyl Interior, White Wall Radial Tires, and Hub Caps. Whether you are looking for a cool car to cruise around town in or a car to take to some shows, this classic Cougar fits the bill. This 1970 Mercury Cougar Convertible for sale is located in our Indianapolis Showroom and can be seen in greater detail, including a High Def video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com. Please call (317)688-1100 or email us at INDY@gatewayclassiccars.com for additional information.
title: 1970 Mercury Cougar
